intro: Hieracium psilolepis, commonly known as the slender hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it has slender, upright stems with alternate, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in a single head, with ray florets surrounding a central disk. Hieracium psilolepis is often found in temperate climates and is relatively easy to cultivate in gardens.
